summary:
Capital Change Notice (Performance Rights Issuance)

  • Issuer: Briscoe Group Limited (NZX: BGP)
  • Securities Issued: 164,657 Performance Rights (entitling holders to one ordinary share each)
  • Total Performance Rights Outstanding: 575,019 (post-issue)
  • Vesting Conditions:
  • 50% subject to 3-year Total Shareholder Return (TSR) performance hurdle (sliding scale).
  • 50% subject to 3-year Earnings Per Share (EPS) growth hurdle (sliding scale).
  • Vesting date: After announcement of 2027/28 audited financial results.
  • Impact on Equity: Potential dilution of 0.0739% of total ordinary shares (post-issue).
  • Reason: Part of long-term executive incentive program (no cash consideration).
  • Authority: Board resolution (24 July 2025) under NZX Listing Rule 4.6.1.

No material trading or capital-raising implications identified (non-cash, performance-linked issuance).

• FY25 Financial Guidance:
  • Underlying EBITDA: $100–110m (vs. $45.2m in FY24)
  • Underlying NPAT: Breakeven (vs. -$60.4m in FY24)
  • Reported net loss: -$27m to -$40m (vs. -$182.1m in FY24)
  • Reported EBITDA: $50–68m (vs. -$4.1m in FY24)
  • Key Issue: Manufacturing challenges at Dunsandel facility (now resolved) incurred one-off costs.
  • Debt Target: Closing net debt of ~$300m (banking covenants complied with).
  • FY25 Results Date: 29 September 2025.

Focus: Improved outlook but still loss-making; monitor debt and operational execution.

EROAD FY25 Climate Statement Summary

Key Material Information:

  1. Climate Disclosure
  2. EROAD published its second annual Group Climate Statement, complying with Aotearoa New Zealand Climate Standards.

  3. Report focuses on climate-related risks, opportunities, and emissions reduction strategies.

  4. Emissions & Targets

  5. FY25 Emissions:
    • Total GHG emissions: 11,416 tCO₂e (53% reduction from FY23 baseline).
    • Scope 1 (Direct): 152.5 tCO₂e (-9% YoY).
    • Scope 2 (Energy): 74.4 tCO₂e (-9% YoY).
    • Scope 3 (Indirect): 11,189 tCO₂e (-53% YoY, driven by operational efficiencies).

  6. Science-aligned targets:

    • 54.6% reduction in Scope 1 & 2 emissions by 2033 (vs. FY23).
    • 61% reduction in emissions intensity (per $1M revenue) by 2033.
    • Net Zero by 2050 (Scopes 1, 2, and 3).

  7. Operational Highlights

  8. Reduced freight emissions via consolidated shipments and rail usage in NZ/AU.
  9. 100% hardware waste diverted from landfill (global e-waste recycling program).

  10. Shift to 100% renewable electricity in NZ (Ecotricity) and site consolidation.

  11. Customer Impact

  12. Sustainability Module (NZ): 1,005 fleet customers tracking emissions (launched FY24).
  13. AI dashcams (Clarity Edge): Reduced high-risk driving, lowering fuel use and accidents.

  14. Cold-chain efficiency: Customers cut pre-cooling time by 65%, reducing fuel waste.

  15. Governance & Risks

  16. Board and Sustainability Committee oversee climate strategy.
  17. Key risks: Supply chain disruption, regulatory shifts, tech competition.

  18. Opportunities: EV integration, emissions-data partnerships, fleet decarbonization tools.

  19. Assurance & Compliance

  20. Emissions data assured by Toitū Envirocare (Scope 1–2: reasonable assurance; Scope 3: limited).

Conclusion:

EROAD’s focus remains on internal decarbonization (e.g., fleet electrification, renewables) and enabling customer emissions reduction (via telematics/AI). No material financial impacts or capital raises announced.

Note: Excluded non-material details (e.g., governance names, operational HR metrics). Data sourced from FY25 Climate Statement and Sustainability Report.

• CEO Appointment: Nikhil Ravishankar appointed as new CEO of Air New Zealand, effective 20 October 2025, succeeding Greg Foran.
  • Background: Current Chief Digital Officer; led tech, loyalty, and customer initiatives at Air New Zealand.
  • Market Impact: Leadership transition noted as strategic shift with focus on digital, innovation, and future challenges (e.g., climate change, cost pressures).

No material financial or capital markets data identified.
